commitResults.messageTitle: Bug report / Team response: Replace placeholder text with a hint (#716)
commitResults.messageBody:
When a user opens a new bug report / new team response,
the response form gets filled in with some placeholder text.

Users sometimes wish to submit their bug report / team response
without a written response. In these cases, they have to manually
delete the placeholder text, before submitting the form.

Let's replace the placeholder text with a hint, to make
the user experience smoother.

commitResults.messageTitle: Issue model: Remove unnecessary ternary operators (#715)
commitResults.messageBody:
Let's improve readability by removing the
ternary operator from some long / confusing statements
in the Issue class.

commitResults.messageTitle: LoggingService: Improve tests by minimising implementation details (#725)
commitResults.messageBody:
A lot of implementation details are used in the logging service tests.
This makes it difficult to maintain the tests, because we have to
spend additional effort ensuring the test code's correctness.
In addition, it is difficult to refactor the logging service,
as refactoring will also require changes to the test code.

Let's redesign the tests such that they only use methods that
are can be considered part of the logging service's public API.

commitResults.messageTitle: Web version auth: redirect to GitHub, instead of using pop-up (#729)
commitResults.messageBody:
The web version of CATcher opens a pop-up window to visit
the GitHub login page.

This hampers the user experience slightly as users
have to enable pop-ups for CATcher, before using it.
In addition, we have to maintain code for managing the pop-up
window.

Let's make CATcher redirect to the GitHub login page
within the same window, instead of using a pop-up.
This will make our code simpler, while eliminating
conflicts arising from browser settings or pop-up blockers.

commitResults.messageTitle: AuthComponent: Log the selected settings repo (#720)
commitResults.messageBody:
For easier troubleshooting, let's log the name of the settings repo
selected by the user.

As the `assertSessionDataIntegrity` operator already performs
validation of the session data, there is no need to validate the
current phase again in the PhaseService#storeSessionData method.

Let's remove the additional check in PhaseService#storeSessionData.

commitResults.messageTitle: Increase number of labels in a single fetch (#728)
commitResults.messageBody:
We do not specify the number of labels to fetch when using the GitHub,
API; hence it fetches a default number of 30 labels in a single fetch.

Fetching the maximum number of labels allowed by the API will allow
us to fetch all labels in most repos and reduce chances of bugs
that occur when all labels are not fetched.

Let's set the number of labels to be retrieved in a single
fetch to be 100 (the maximum possible)

Methods used to parse data.csv file have vague return types such as
{}. Readers have to delve into the details of each method to understand
the structure of the returned value.

Let's
- Define data types for the different kinds of parsed data
- Specify the returned data type for the different data parsing methods

This will help developers understand the kind of data being parsed
and returned for each method under data.service.
